headline: Magical Egg Salad
description: The magic in the simple egg salad is a splash of steak sauce.
name: Magical Egg Salad
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel.
Chop eggs and transfer to a large bowl.
Stir mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, sweet pickle relish, steak sauce, paprika, and dill into eggs until well mixed; season with salt and black pepper. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, if desired.
Sprinkle with cayenne pepper before serving.

review.reviewBody: Way too much mustard for my taste. Next time I'll try 2 tsp instead of 2 Tbsp.
Perfect for lunch! Kept me full all day, very tempted to add bacon next time I make it!
What KIND of steak sauce did you use?? There are countless steak sauces out there all different - can any one suggest one by name? Thanks..

Absolutely the best egg salad I have ever had! This is the perfect balance of ingredients, and I am not sure what make it so outstanding, the steak sauce? We all loved it and cannot wait to make it again. Thank you!

Made this as described and was not disappointed. The steak sauce, dijon mustard and dash of cayenne pepper give the typical egg salad explosion of flavors. I'll be making egg salad this way from now on.
Cayenne pepper is awesome in egg salad. I used worstershire for the steak sauce. It was too much relish for me, but otherwise a good salad. Thanks for the ideas.

I grew up eating egg salad sandwiches with a nice big dill pickle.
2 of my 3 kids love egg salad sandwiches but the youngest turns his nose up at even the thought of egg salad.
Guess that's due to me having chickens for years & eggs were always the go to for a meal.

I added about 10 olives and used 6 eggs
Turned out great
I’ll try it again but cut the Dijon mustard in half.
It was too much dijon mustard. I backed off on it a bit per other reviews and it was still too strong. I'd make this again but probably just use a couple tsp of the dijon next time.
Followed recipe except i used 6 eggs.. It was soupy. I will pass on this. The taste was off I think it was the steak sauce. Tested and tried.. It's a NO GO!
I very much dislike even a drop of mustard (in most recipes) because that is ALL you taste is the mustard! Otherwise the recipe was good.
Only change I made was using regular mustard because I didn't have dijon. Thought it was delicious. A little bit odd, honestly, but it was good. Will probably make it again.
i loved how ater i chilled it for awhile it was to die for

Flavors seem good. This method of cooking the eggs did not work at all for me though. Egg whites were still a little runny, and yolks were not cooked through, resulting in a soupy mess. I will try it again with a differed method of cooking the eggs.

I made this exactly following the recipe, no changes and it is AMAZING! I'm not a good cook at all, I need to follow recipes to a tee, and struggled for years to find a good egg salad recipe.. thank you!
Made it to exact ingredient specifications eyeballing my measurements. Very good!
Delish! I added green On and a little bit of red onion and did not have steak sauce so used wish to shower sauce and it turned out great

No changes made and I will not be making this again and I'll tell you why. The color of the salad was an unappealing yellow, the texture was more of a loose topping, and the taste wasn't that great either. Enough.
I wasn't really impressed. I used A-1 steak sauce and it just took over the whole dish. I won't make it again using A-1
Although I did like the taste - I found it way too soupy for me - next time I make it, I will use less mayo and less mustard.
This had way too much Dijon mustard. I will use just half of it, next time.
I didn't make any changes. Made finger sandwiches with it for a baby shower and it was a hit. My family loves it too!

An interesting twist to "plain old" egg salad. The only change I made was using fresh dill weed instead of dry and omitting the cayenne pepper. I did not feel that the salad needed additional salt as the steak sauce added plenty. I will definitely make this again as even my picky kids enjoyed it.
This is a fabulous recipe made special, I think, by the use of the teaspoon of steak sauce! I didn't have dill when i made it and it still turned out great.
Excellent recipe, the steak sauce gave it great flavour!

Was good, not much different than how I usually make it. I cut back a little on the mustard and omitted the sweet relish but followed the recipe otherwise. Couldn't taste the steak sauce at all. Would make again adding some onion and a little more steak sauce.
Delicious and super easy. I put a couple extra diced eggs in mine as it seemed very saucy. It wouldn't have been bad as originally written, just not the consistency for my personal preference.
I like all of the ingredients but together it just didn't do it for me. I would increase Mayo, reduce Mustard and cut steak sauce in half.
I made this egg salad today as stated and we found it had a bitter taste, so did not like it. I added another egg and more mayo until the bitter taste was gone.
There is nothing magical about this egg salad, I ended up adding more eggs to cover up the taste!
It is delicious! Will definitely claim it as my favorite at family gatherings thanks to A/R!

I love egg salad and thought I would try this twist. It was good but far from my favorite. I followed the recipe to the letter and it came out pretty runny. I think that's what killed it for me. Next time I will add a couple of extra eggs.
This recipe was fine on it's own! 4 stars with NO changes.
Great!
Delicious and easy. Enough said
Excellent egg salad! Had to leave out steak sauce because I didn't have any. The flavor was still amazing. This will be my new go to egg salad recipe!

Because we do not like sweet pickles, I used equal amounts (maybe more) of chopped garlic dills. I also added a little garlic/onion powder. Interesting but delicious egg salad. My son and I shared it and we both really enjoyed it. I will make it again.
best egg salad I ever had did not change a thing but might put a little celery next time as i love celery
This is a great recipe. I love making egg salad but wanted to try something a little different. I loved the spiciness of it. I would not change anything about it. Thanks!
Very good! I did cut the mustard in half based on other reviews but that's all I changed and it turned out yummy!
Fantastic egg salad! Pretty close to how I normally make it, but the addition of the Worcestershire gave it that little extra something. Will make this version from now on!
EXCELLENT! The steak sauce really gives it something extra. Yum!
Tasty and simple - great for sandwiches. I didn't have minced onion, so I'll have to try again with all the ingredients.

Enjoyed this recipe! Next time I will use more mayo and less of the steak sauce, halve the mustard and relish. I used A1 steak sauce and I don't know if that made it taste so strong. This is personal preference of course. I would have never thought to put steak sauce in but it really adds a little bold kick. I will make this again.

Hands down best recipe I have had in years. Watch the quantities as mine came out kind of soupy. Still tasted great but I will cut the liquid part and maybe the mustard as the mustard taste came through a little too much. Still it was great.
This recipe is quick to make and delicious. The steak sauce is an awesome addition. None of the ingredients really overpowers the others, it is well balanced. I will definitely make this again!
Loved this. Tried it as is and it was everything I wanted for an egg salad sandwich.
Very good. I enjoyed the change from the usual egg salad.
As I didn't have relish I used sweet gherkin slices, chopped & added 3 TBSP of sour cream to make it go further....great recipe with a heap of taste....
As written, this came out way too sweet for our taste. It took some tinkering to get it be more savory.
Different
My wife wanted egg salad so I found this recipe, which is quick and easy. I made it and she said, "Wow! This is really good! What did you do differently?" To which I responded, "It's magic."

Delish. I too added some chopped sweet onion and used chopped dill pickle. This was great on grilled French bread. The steak sauce (A1) really adds something. I would have never thought of this. Thanks!

I doubled the recipe. I didn't change a thing except for the dill - only used half of the recommended amount (as I am not a huge fan) and didn't add salt (there was already plenty with the steak sauce, mustard and relish). I personally thought that the Dijon was a bit overpowering, so I will definitely use less next time. Good stuff - will be better (for my personal taste, of course) after I make my own additional tweaks.

I didn't quite have all the ingredients on hand, so as other commenters suggested, I substituted a chopped kosher dill pickle for relish, and worcestershire sauce + bbq sauce for the steak sauce. I used 'country style' dijon (which I like better), and mixed in a bit of finely chopped shallot. Delicious!

I was intrigued about the unique combination of ingredients in this egg salad recipe, but in the end it just didn’t appeal to me. Apparently what intrigued me, the combination of sweet pickle relish, Dijon (way too much of it at that), steak sauce and dill wasn’t a good combination for me. It’s always interesting to try something “outside the box” but in this case I’m glad I only made a small batch of this.
Although it was good, it was a bit too tangy for my taste. I also agree with another reviewer that it was too runny. If I make it again I'll leave out the relish.
Eggsellent! Egg salad brought to a new level! I subbed Worcestershire for steak sauce because that's what I had and yay! for sugar free sweet relish for low carbers!

Just made it, and I think it tastes great! I didn't have dijon mustard so had to use regular yellow and used a dill pickle in place of relish, but it's still pretty tasty. I took the advice of others and added some onion- great idea! Thanks for sharing this recipe!

It really was very magical, and by far the best recipe for egg salad on this site. I quest (for ten years now) for the perfect egg salad recipe and think this may be it with one caveat, be careful of the salt as it appears to be a staple of steak sauce. I added 1/4 teaspoon of salt, "to taste", tasted, and wow was it salty. Also, I always add chopped macademia nuts for crunch and it is possible that this did me in as they always come salted. Still, I feel like I am one step closer to the perfect egg salad, thanks for posting.
it was a bit too runny for my tastes. I added 3 more eggs to balance it out.
Very easy and tasty.
I added sliced carrots to it! YUM!!! and i skipped the cayenne

Excellent. Made exactly as written and it is delicious! 
Thanks for sharing!

Amazing! Ive never made egg salad before and this recipe is easy and I made it with stuff I had in the house! I used spicy mustard due to not having dijon and no dill. It was still fantastic! I added Worcestershire sauce as well. Everything was perfect...in the past I HATED egg salad...then I tried this one, and even I will munch on it!!
EXCELLENT. Followed the recipe exactly! The flavors go well together. I will definitely be making this again !
Typically, I love a traditional egg salad and didn't think that I'd like the extra dijon flavor in this recipe. However, I was surprised. It has a lot of flavor and tastes great!
I found this recipe to be very easy and very delicious. It's perfect for a fast lunch.
Yum! I added a little hot sauce and a little less mayo just b/c I'm on a diet, but it tastes amazing!
AMAZING! I believe they use this sauce (minus the eggs) for dipping chicken tenders at several restaurants in the area!! I've been trying to duplicate it forever!

super quick and easy and it's creamy and delicious - I didn't have steak sauce so I used 1 tsp of worcestshire sauce + 1 tbs bbq sauce. Hint: Instead of chopping the eggs, just use a potato masher. I should have cooked the eggs for 1 or 2 minutes longer because part of the whites peeled off with the shell.

This was really delicious! Left out the cayenne and subbed dill pickle (since we didn't have relish), but the steak sauce and dijon make it delish! I believe I cut back a bit on the mayo as well and it was still very creamy.
Very creamy & the steak sauce adds just the right zest,delish
Excellent. Just the right amount of zing.

this is delicious although I had to increase wet ingredients for more moisture. I used potato masher to chop up the eggs to save time. Flavors went well together. Not your usual boring egg salad. Give it a try!
This recipe was awesome. My boyfriend loved it. The steak sauce is a brilliant idea. I didn't have relish so I substituted it with a chopped pickle, which gave it a great crunch. Thanks for sharing.
This is the best egg salad we've ever had! However, I did modify it a bit... I added finely chopped onion, chopped water chestnuts (for crunch) and didn't add the cayenne (for the child). Awesome!
This is an excellant recipe. The only change - I added some chopped onion. I loved the extra flavor the mustand and the stake sauce gave it. I am sure I will be making this again.
yum. didn't do anything different to it, just fine the way it is.
Eggcellent egg salad! Used dill pickles instead of sweet pickles. Yummy flavor - great!!!

Excellent. I didnt have sweet relish opened and didnt want to struggle with the big jar for such a little bit so I chopped up a big dill pickle and used it. This was good and a new twist on egg salad.

This was way better than the mayo-relish-s&p egg salad I usually make. The dijon mustard and splash of steak sauce give it a little tang and a lot of taste (I omitted cayenne for my toddler, so no comment on that). The only thing I might add next time is a bit of diced onion. Thanks Emily!
This recipe was awesome, I intended on sharing with a friend, but ended up eating all myself!
